newsitem.title: USA: Calif. lawmakers fail to pass bond, budget bills.
newsitem.headline: Calif. lawmakers fail to pass bond, budget bills.

text.p: California's state Legislature concluded its 1996 session without acting on several key measures.
- Efforts to place massive school and park bond measures on the state ballot failed. The school bonds would have helped to fund construction.
- A measure that could have forced the state Legislature to pass balanced budgets failed in a Senate panel.
- A measure that could have made it easier for the San Fernando Valley to secede from Los Angeles stalled in a Senate committee.
